Description: Rim sherd of large North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior streakily glazed with traces of added colour bands; outside: band of tongues between lines at rim; below, animal frieze to left; uncertain creature at left, followed by a swan (much of neck and head and part of wing); added red; rosettes as full. Graffito on inside.
Curator's comments: The piece is very close to 1924,1201.969, and is probably from the same vase. It is less likely that the texts on the two belong to the same phrase, since the length of the tongues with their lower boundary line is slightly different at the relevant breaks. The uncertainty of the inscriber is apparent on both sherds, and the wheel-marks coincide. Pencilled attempt at rendering the graffito on the interior.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.201)
